input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: MSSCCMActor.

Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target>config1</target> <applications-search-criteria> <ci-id></ci-id> <display-name></display-name> <ci-unique-id></ci-unique-id> </applications-search-criteria>
<collection-id></collection-id> <assignment-name></assignment-name> <assignment-description></assignment-description> <action></action> <purpose></purpose> <require-admin-approval></require-admin-approval> <predeploy-software></predeploy-software> <send-wakeup-packets></send-wakeup-packets> <use-gmt-times></use-gmt-times> <start-time></start-time> <enforcement-deadline></enforcement-deadline> <notify-user></notify-user> <allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window> <software-installation></software-installation> <system-restart></system-restart> </allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window> <priority></priority> <suppress-reboot></suppress-reboot> <disable-mom-alerts></disable-mom-alerts> <log-compliance-to-win-event></log-compliance-to-win-event> <non-compliance-criticality></non-compliance-criticality> <raise-mom-alerts-on-failure></raise-mom-alerts-on-failure> <send-detailed-non-compliance-status></send-detailed-non-compliance-status> <user-ui-experience></user-ui-experience> <state-message-priority></state-message-priority>
</item> </items>
Elements' Description:
item [Required] This is a child tag of <items> tag. The <item> tag can be specified multiple times to support "multiple items support".
target [Optional]: This element to specify the connection information for the Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager application.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: The value of this tag is case sensitive.
applications-search-criteria [Required]
An element to enclose Applications Search criteria. This element encloses <ci-id>, <display-name> and <ci-unique-id> elements inside it.
ci-id [Conditional] The unique ID of the configuration item (Application in this case) to search. This ID is unique only for the site.
display-name [Conditional] The localized display name of the Application to be searched.
ci-unique-id [Conditional]
The unique ID of the configuration item (Application) to be searched. This ID is unique across sites.
Note: One of the three search criteria elements - <ci-id>, <display-name> and <ci-unique-id> is required.
collection-id [Required] The Collection Id to which the Application needs to be deployed.
assignment-name [Required] A logical name given to the Application Deployment Assignment.
assignment-description [Optional] Description for the Application Deployment Assignment.
action [Required] The action to be performed with the application.
Valid values are: - Install - Uninstall
purpose [Required]
The purpose of the application - whether the application deployment is mandatory or not.
Valid values are: - Required - Available
Note: In case the deployment 'action' is 'Uninstall', then the only valid value is 'Required'.
require-admin-approval [Optional] - Indicates whether the Application deployment needs admin approval.
Valid values are: - True - False
Note: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Available'
predeploy-software [Optional] Indicates whether the application is to be pre-deployed on the client.
Valid values are: - True - False
Note: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Required'
send-wakeup-packets [Optional] Indicates whether to send a Wake On Lan (WoL) transmission to the client when the deadline is reached for the assignment.
Valid values are: - True - False
Note: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Required'
use-gmt-times [Optional] Flag to indicate if the time values specified are in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). The default value is 'True'.
start-time [Optional] The date and time when the Application Deployment is to be offered.
Format: YYYYmmDDhhMMss.MMMMMM+***
Default: Current System Time (equivalent to the 'As soon as possible' option)
Note: The start time can not be less than the current date minus 1 day.
enforcement-deadline [Optional]
The date and time when the application deployment will be enforced.
Format: YYYYmmDDhhMMss.MMMMMM+***
Default: Current System Time + 7 days
Note 1: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Required' This value is ignored if the 'purpose' of the application is 'Available'. Note 2: The enforcement-deadline if specified should be greater than the <start-time>.
notify-user [Optional] Flag to indicate whether to notify the user when the application is available. The default value is 'False'.
allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window [Optional] This element contains child elements to indicate activities that a client can perform on reaching the deadline.
software-installation [Optional] Indicates whether a client should install the application.
Note: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Required'
system-restart [Optional] Indicates whether a client should restart the device after the installation.
Note: Valid only when the 'purpose' of the application is 'Required'
priority [Optional] The priority of the application deployment.
Valid values are: - Low - Medium - High
Default - Medium
suppress-reboot [Optional] Value indicating whether the client should not reboot the computer, if there is a reboot pending after the application is applied.
Possible values are:
- SUPPRESS_REBOOT_WORKSTATIONS - SUPPRESS_REBOOT_SERVERS
disable-mom-alerts [Optional] Indicates if the client is configured to raise MOM alerts when the application is applied. The default value is 'False'.
log-compliance-to-win-event [Optional] Indicates whether to log compliance status to Windows event logs. The default value is 'False'.
non-compliance-criticality [Optional] The application's non-compliance criticality for the assignment.
Valid values: Any value from 0 to 99
raise-mom-alerts-on-failure [Optional] Indicates whether the client should raise MOM alerts if it fails to apply the application. The default value is 'False'.
send-detailed-non-compliance-status [Optional] Indicates whether to send a detailed non-compliance status message. The default value is 'False'.
user-ui-experience [Optional] Indicates if user notification is displayed. The default value is 'False'.
state-message-priority [Optional] Priority of state message to be reported from client.
Valid values are: - Urgent - High - Normal - Low
Default - Normal
